channel.title: How do i add customs
channel.description: how do i add customs for overload x ??

item.title: How do i add customs
item.dc:creator: @thock321 thock321
item.description:
@thock321 wrote:

custom items or npcs? However, before you add a custom you need the model file. The model file (if you dont know) is a file with numbers and a dat extensions, for e.g. : 2147.dat. you put the dat file into the raw folder in Client\cache\Data\Raw. Then you add the ints into item.def. OverloadX comes with a bunch of customs.
to add the ints to item.def search for itemDef.description = "Rosejuice's wings of anarchy".getBytes();
then under the break;
add this

case ####://item id you want it to be, replace #### with item id itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wear";//or equip or sth itemDef.modelID = ####;//the inventory model id itemDef.modelZoom = ####;//the zoom itemDef.modelRotation1 = ####;//rotation itemDef.modelRotation2 = ####;//rotation itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;//not sure lol, leave it at 0 itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0;//still not sure itemDef.anInt204 = 14;//still dont know... itemDef.maleEquip1 = 45003;//the equip model for male characters itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 45003;//the equip model for female characters itemDef.name = "A cool name";//the name you want your item to be itemDef.description = "A badass description".getBytes();//description for item break;
itemDef.java is located in the client folder

Read full topic
